name: A. green_gold_dog, array and permutation
statement:
green_gold_dog has an array a of length n, and he wants to find a
permutation b of length n such that the number of distinct numbers in
the element-wise difference between array a and permutation b is
maximized.A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct
integers from 1 to n in any order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a
permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (as 2 appears twice in the
array) and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (as n=3, but 4 appears in
the array).The element-wise difference between two arrays a and b of
length n is an array c of length n, where c_i = a_i - b_i (1
leq i
leq n).
